column4: I use Ubuntu with the xfce desktop and someone is logged into the computer and has their screensaver running. Is it possible for me to log into VT1 and start the xfce desktop on VT8?
Ctrl-Alt-F1 should get you to VT1, not sure what the command would be though, maybe startxfce or some such thing, and then just check the man to specify VT8.
do you have a good guide for writing a muttrc?
I wish. I had someone walk me through it and I'm still learning.
That's the second time today neo_ has done that
Yeah, I know....sigh - give it another moment here
How did you know it should be in #ubuntu+1? Because of the "20" ?
Because his forums post says Feisty on it in the corner ;)
those look like templates for openoffice.org, but I've never seen them show up on any of my 11 Ubuntu systems
you might want to tweak the "templates" path in oo.o
I haven't tried to make any templates though - any idea what would?
iirc, oo.o has ~/Documents in the templates path, but you can change that within oo.o prefs
no, it has /home/anthony/.openoffice.org2/user/template.  ~/Documents is the path for "My Documents" only.
.odt is open document template, it looks like it's keeping copies of the templates in Documents
and more importantly, regardless of where it puts such things, what kind of nonsense is automatically creating files like this ?
this is one of the reason I don't use that suite ;)
gnome-office is in the repos, that may be more to your liking
